bio.text: Dan Kemp is  the chief research and investment officer for Morningstar*. Dan leads the Research and Investment team that comprises Morningstar’s fundamental research, manager selection, and investment management activities. The latter will encompass multi-asset, equity, and quantitative strategies, including our direct indexing capability.
Kemp joined Morningstar in 2014 as co-Head of Investment Consulting and Portfolio Management in the EMEA region. He most recently served as Global Chief Investment Officer for the Wealth Group.

Dan holds a bachelor’s degree in theology from King’s College London. He also holds the Investment Management Certificate, the Securities Institute Diploma and the Advanced Financial Planning Certificate.

by.shortBio: Fernando Luque is a senior financial analyst for Morningstar.

bio.text: After seven years as a fund director at the Spanish Consumer Organization, Fernando Luque joined Morningstar in May 2001 with the arrival of the company in Spain. Since then, he has held the position of senior financial analyst,  providing articles and commentary through Morningstar Spain. He regularly publishes articles in Estrategias de inversión, Inversión & Finanzas, El Economista, and FundsPeople and participates in TV and radio programs dedicated to investment funds. Luque has also participated in numerous talks about Morningstar's different methodologies.

by.name: Amy C Arnott
by.title: Portfolio Strategist
by.shortBio: Amy C. Arnott, CFA is a portfolio strategist for Morningstar. Email Amy at amy.arnott@morningstar.com. She reads all of the emails she receives but doesn't always have time to send a personal response.

bio.text: Amy C. Arnott, CFA, is a portfolio strategist for Morningstar. In her role as portfolio strategist, she writes about portfolio construction, asset allocation, retirement planning, and other personal finance topics. Her research explores a wide range of asset classes and how investors and financial advisors can use them to build better portfolios. Arnott co-hosts Morningstar’s “The Long View” podcast and is a key contributor to research such as Morningstar’s annual Diversification Landscape and State of Retirement Income papers.

Before rejoining Morningstar in 2019, Arnott was an Associate Wealth Advisor at Buckingham Strategic Wealth, where she was responsible for portfolio analysis, asset allocation, rebalancing, and trade recommendations. Arnott originally joined Morningstar as a mutual fund analyst in 1991 and held a variety of leadership roles in investment research, corporate finance, and strategy from 1991 to 2017.
Arnott holds a bachelor’s degree with honors in English and French from the University of Wisconsin – Madison. She also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst® designation.

by.shortBio: Sarah Hansen is a senior reporter for Morningstar. Email Sarah at sarah.hansen2@morningstar.com.

bio.text: Sarah Hansen is a senior reporter for Morningstar.com. She covers markets and the economy, with a focus on helping investors cut through the noise. Before joining Morningstar in 2023, Hansen was a senior writer for Money Magazine, covering investing and personal finance. She has also written for Forbes and Investopedia.

Hansen holds a bachelor’s degree in English and art history from Northwestern University. She also holds a master’s degree in business and economic journalism from New York University's Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute, for which she completed coursework at the Stern School of Business.

by.name: Ivanna Hampton
by.title: Lead Multimedia Editor
by.shortBio: Ivanna Hampton is a lead multimedia editor for Morningstar.

bio.text: Ivanna Hampton is a lead multimedia editor for Morningstar. She coordinates and produces videos for Morningstar.com and other channels. Hampton is also the host and editor of the Investing Insights podcast. Prior to these roles, she was a senior engagement editor and served as the homepage editor for Morningstar.com.

Before joining Morningstar in 2020, Hampton spent more than 11 years working as a content producer for NBC in Chicago, the country’s third-largest media market. She wrote stories and edited video for TV and digital. She also produced newscasts, interview segments, and reporter live shots.

Hampton holds a bachelor's degree in journalism from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. She also holds a master's degree in public affairs reporting from the University of Illinois at Springfield. Follow Hampton at @ivanna.hampton on Instagram.

by.shortBio: Sara Silano is an editorial manager for Morningstar.

bio.text: Sara Silano is the editorial manager for Morningstar Italy. She writes about the global markets, bonds, macroeconomics, mutual funds, exchange-traded funds, financial education, and sustainable investing. In 2018, she won a State Street Italy Institutional Press Award in the Investment Management category for an article about the "Kodak moment" of the asset-management industry.

Before joining Morningstar in 2003, Silano was a contributor for Bloomberg News and editor at the weekly newspaper Bloomberg Investimenti. She has covered a wide array of investment topics, including funds, financial advice, tech stocks, and global financial markets.
Silano holds a communications degree from Torino University.

by.name: Dan Lefkovitz
by.title: Strategist
by.shortBio: Dan Lefkovitz is a strategist for Morningstar Indexes.

bio.text: Dan Lefkovitz is strategist for Morningstar Indexes, a contributor to various Morningstar research publications, and a co-host of The Long View podcast. Before assuming his Indexes' role in 2015, he spent 11 years on Morningstar’s manager research team. He held several different roles, including analyst and director of the company’s institutional research service. From 2008 to 2012, he was based in London, helping to build Morningstar’s fund research capability across Europe and Asia. As an analyst, he edited the Fidelity Fund Family report from 2006 to 2008.

Before joining Morningstar in 2004, Lefkovitz served as director of risk analysis for Marvin Zonis + Associates, a Chicago-based consultancy. During this time, he coauthored The Kimchi Matters: Global Business and Local Politics in a Crisis-Driven World (Agate, 2003).
Lefkovitz holds a bachelor's degree from the University of Michigan and a master's degree from the University of Chicago.

disclosureStatements.text: Morningstar, Inc., licenses indexes to financial institutions as the tracking indexes for investable products, such as exchange-traded funds, sponsored by the financial institution. The license fee for such use is paid by the sponsoring financial institution based mainly on the total assets of the investable product. A list of ETFs that track a Morningstar index is available via the Capabilities section at indexes.morningstar.com. A list of other investable products linked to a Morningstar index is available upon request. Morningstar, Inc., does not market, sell, or make any representations regarding the advisability of investing in any investable product that tracks a Morningstar index.

by.name: Grant Slade
by.title: Senior Equity Analyst
by.shortBio: Grant Slade, CFA, was a senior equity analyst for Morningstar.

bio.text: Grant Slade, CFA, was a senior equity analyst for Morningstar.* He covered European industrials companies.

Before his most recent role, Slade was a senior equity analyst for Morningstar Australasia, where he covered building and construction materials, packaging, and other industrials stocks. Before joining Morningstar in 2018, Slade was an equity research analyst with Capital Dynamics, a global fund manager based across the Asia-Pacific region.

Slade holds a master’s degree in economics from the University of Sydney and bachelor's degrees in economics and biotechnology from the Queensland University of Technology. He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst® designation.
*Morningstar Holland BV (“Morningstar”) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Morningstar, Inc.

bio.text: Antje Schiffler is an editor for Morningstar Germany and Morningstar Switzerland. She covers an array of investment and macroeconomic topics, with a focus on the German and Swiss markets.
Before joining Morningstar in 2022, Schiffler spent over 15 years at Dow Jones, starting as an energy market reporter in New York and later serving as a senior analyst in Frankfurt.
Schiffler holds master’s degrees in economics and American culture studies from Bowling Green State University in Ohio.

by.title: Editor

bio.text: Margaret Giles is a senior content development editor for Morningstar. With a focus on individual investors, she supports digital content experiences that cover a range of topics, including portfolio decisions and other personal finance questions.

Giles joined Morningstar's editorial team in 2019 as a data journalist for Morningstar.com. She transitioned to an editor role in content development in 2023. Giles holds bachelor's degrees in economics and Spanish from Grinnell College.

by.name: Sarah Hansen
by.title: Senior Reporter
by.shortBio: Sarah Hansen is a senior reporter for Morningstar. Email Sarah at sarah.hansen2@morningstar.com.

bio.text: Sarah Hansen is a senior reporter for Morningstar.com. She covers markets and the economy, with a focus on helping investors cut through the noise. Before joining Morningstar in 2023, Hansen was a senior writer for Money Magazine, covering investing and personal finance. She has also written for Forbes and Investopedia.

Hansen holds a bachelor’s degree in English and art history from Northwestern University. She also holds a master’s degree in business and economic journalism from New York University's Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute, for which she completed coursework at the Stern School of Business.

by.name: Sara Silano
by.title: Editorial Manager
by.shortBio: Sara Silano is an editorial manager for Morningstar.

bio.text: Sara Silano is the editorial manager for Morningstar Italy. She writes about the global markets, bonds, macroeconomics, mutual funds, exchange-traded funds, financial education, and sustainable investing. In 2018, she won a State Street Italy Institutional Press Award in the Investment Management category for an article about the "Kodak moment" of the asset-management industry.

Before joining Morningstar in 2003, Silano was a contributor for Bloomberg News and editor at the weekly newspaper Bloomberg Investimenti. She has covered a wide array of investment topics, including funds, financial advice, tech stocks, and global financial markets.
Silano holds a communications degree from Torino University.

by.name: Kunal Kapoor
by.title: Chief Executive Officer
by.shortBio: Kunal Kapoor, CFA, is chief executive officer of Morningstar.

bio.text: Kunal Kapoor, CFA, is chief executive officer of Morningstar. Before assuming his current role in 2017, he served as president, responsible for product development and innovation, sales and marketing, and driving strategic prioritization across the firm.

Since joining Morningstar in 1997 as a data analyst, Kapoor has held a variety of roles at the firm, including leadership positions in research and innovation. He served as director of mutual fund research and was part of the team that launched Morningstar Investment Services, Inc., before moving on to other roles including director of business strategy for international operations, and later, president and chief investment officer of Morningstar Investment Services. During his tenure, he has also led Morningstar.com® and the firm’s data business as well as its global products and client solutions group.

Kapoor holds a bachelor’s degree in economics and environmental policy from Monmouth College and a master’s degree in business administration from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst® designation, is a member of the CFA Society of Chicago, and served on the board of PitchBook, a private firm that provides a comprehensive private equity and venture capital database, prior to its acquisition by Morningstar in late 2016. Kapoor is also a member of the board of trustees of The Nature Conservancy in Illinois. In 2010, Crain’s Chicago Business named him to its annual 40 Under 40 class, a list that includes professionals from a variety of industries who are contributing to Chicago’s business, civic, and philanthropic landscape.

by.name: Philip Straehl
by.title: Chief Investment Officer, Americas
by.shortBio: Philip Straehl is chief investment officer, Americas, for Morningstar Wealth.

bio.text: Philip Straehl is chief investment officer, Americas, for Morningstar Wealth and is part of the leadership team responsible for $328 billion in global assets under management and advisement. Most recently, Philip served as chief investment officer for Quantitative Strategies as part of the Morningstar Investment Management team, where he was responsible for the firm’s systematic strategies and direct indexing capability. Prior to that, Philip was global head of research for Morningstar Investment Management, managing the research and risk capability for all global investment offerings. Advisory services under Morningstar Wealth are offered by Morningstar Investment Management LLC, a registered investment adviser and subsidiary of Morningstar, Inc.

by.name: Preston Caldwell
by.title: Strategist
by.shortBio: Preston Caldwell is senior US economist for Morningstar Research Services LLC.

bio.text: Preston Caldwell is senior US economist for Morningstar.* He leads the research team's views on US macroeconomic issues, including gross domestic product growth, inflation, interest rates, and monetary policy.
Previously, Caldwell served as a member of the energy sector team, covering oilfield-services stocks and helping to craft Morningstar's long-term oil price forecasts.
Caldwell holds a bachelor's degree in economics from the University of Arkansas and earned his Master of Business Administration from Rice University.
*Morningstar Research Services LLC (“Morningstar”) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Morningstar, Inc.

by.name: Toby  Moerschen
by.title: Managing Director of Private Corporate Credit
by.shortBio: Toby Moerschen is managing director of Private Corporate Credit, for Morningstar DBRS.

bio.text: Toby Moerschen is a managing director, corporate ratings, for Morningstar DBRS. He provides analysis, research and data on companies across a range of industries. Moerschen is responsible for teams covering large corporates as well as small firms with high debt burdens (middle market) globally.

Before joining Morningstar in 2023, Moerschen worked in investment research at a bank-owned asset manager, an insurer, and a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund. Moerschen previously worked at another credit rating agency and started his finance career with DBRS.
Moerschen holds an Economics degree from the University of Cologne, Germany, and an MBA from Columbia University.

by.jobTitle: Managing Director of Private Corporate Credit
